channel.title: Comments on: PIC18F2550 KS0108 Graphical LCD Oscilloscope
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: FIO LCD Oscilloscope: Arduino's Visualizer for Electronic Signals
item.dc:creator: FIO LCD Oscilloscope: Arduino's Visualizer for Electronic Signals
item.description: […] has been 7 years (!) since I posted my PIC18F2550 KS0108 Graphical LCD Oscilloscope code and schematics. I have long since taken the circuit apart, sold my PIC microcontrollers, and […]
item.content:encoded: […] has been 7 years (!) since I posted my PIC18F2550 KS0108 Graphical LCD Oscilloscope code and schematics. I have long since taken the circuit apart, sold my PIC microcontrollers, and […]

item.title: By: aishen
item.dc:creator: aishen
item.description: What an excellent project ! I wonder how people can do such a wonder ! lol I tried it in simulide thanks a lot for sharing
item.content:encoded:
What an excellent project ! I wonder how people can do such a wonder ! lol
I tried it in simulide
thanks a lot for sharing

item.title: By: Edward
item.dc:creator: Edward
item.description: So how is PIC18F2550 superior to other O-scopes? Can you please also provide some of it's limitations?
item.content:encoded: So how is PIC18F2550 superior to other O-scopes? Can you please also provide some of it’s limitations?

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2006/08/21/pic18f2550-ks0108-graphical-lcd-oscilloscope/#comment-401">Pilar</a>.
Hello, I have the same situation as you with the error messages. I have been searching around but havn't had any luck with a solution. It might be that I need to find the GLCD.c file. I have been looking for that also. I have the GLCD.Modified.c but I still think we need the GLCD.C file.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Pilar.

Hello, I have the same situation as you with the error messages. I have been searching around but havn’t had any luck with a solution. It might be that I need to find the GLCD.c file. I have been looking for that also. I have the GLCD.Modified.c but I still think we need the GLCD.C file.

item.title: By: Sergio
item.dc:creator: Sergio
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2006/08/21/pic18f2550-ks0108-graphical-lcd-oscilloscope/#comment-210472">Sergio</a>.
Hello Steve, I would try to build an oscilloscope with pic 18f2550, but it would be possible to program the pic hex file directly without the bootloader using my programmer? Many Thanks Sergio P.S. I'm sorry there was an english mistake in the previous post. Best regards
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sergio.

Hello Steve, I would try to build an oscilloscope with pic 18f2550, but it would be possible to program the pic hex file directly without the bootloader using my programmer?
Many Thanks
Sergio
P.S. I’m sorry there was an english mistake in the previous post.
Best regards

item.title: By: Sergio
item.dc:creator: Sergio
item.description: Hello Steve, I would try to build an oscilloscope with pic 18f2550, but it would be possible to program the pic hex file directly with the bootloader without using my programmer? many thanks Sergio
item.content:encoded:
Hello Steve, I would try to build an oscilloscope with pic 18f2550, but it would be possible to program the pic hex file directly with the bootloader without using my programmer?
many thanks
Sergio
